biography.summary: Ted Cruz is an American attorney and politician who serves as the United States Senator from Texas. A Republican, he has been in the Senate since 2013 and previously served as Texas Solicitor General. He is known for his conservative policy positions and active role in national debates on constitutional issues, immigration, and taxation.
biography.early_life: Born December 22, 1970, in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, to Cuban-American and Irish-American parents. He grew up in Texas and attended Princeton University and Harvard Law School.
biography.education: Princeton University, B.A. in Public Policy, 1992; Harvard Law School, J.D., 1995.
biography.career: After clerking for Supreme Court Chief Justice William Rehnquist, Cruz served as Texas Solicitor General (2003â€“2008) and later entered national politics, becoming a U.S. Senator from Texas in 2013.

contact.office_address: 167 Russell Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510
